00019 #include "broadcaster.h"
00020 
00021 void *s_brthreadstart(void* vid)
00022 {
00023         ((Broadcaster*)vid)->threadstart();
00024         return NULL;
00025 }
00026 
00027 
00028 Broadcaster::Broadcaster(Sequencer *seq)
00029 {
00030         pthread_mutex_init(&queue_mutex, NULL);
00031         pthread_cond_init(&queue_cv, NULL);
00032         queue_start=0;
00033         queue_end=0;
00034         sequencer=seq;
00035         id=0;
00036         sock=NULL;
00037         finish=false;
00038         alive=false;
00039 }
00040 
00041 Broadcaster::~Broadcaster(void)
00042 {
00043         stop();
00044         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Cond destroy");
00045         pthread_cond_destroy(&queue_cv); //this can block in certains situations!
00046         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Mutex destroy");
00047         pthread_mutex_destroy(&queue_mutex);
00048         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Returning");
00049 }
00050 
00051 void Broadcaster::reset(int pos, SWInetSocket *socky)
00052 {
00053         pthread_mutex_lock(&queue_mutex);
00054         if (alive)
00055         {
00056                 logmsgf(LOG_ERROR,"Whoa, broadcaster is still alive!");
00057                 pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00058                 return;
00059         }
00060         pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00061         queue_start=0;
00062         queue_end=0;
00063         id=pos;
00064         sock=socky;
00065         finish=false;
00066         alive=true;
00067         //start a listener thread
00068         pthread_create(&thread, NULL, s_brthreadstart, this);
00069 }
00070 
00071 void Broadcaster::stop()
00072 {
00073         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Broadcaster stop called");
00074         finish=true;
00075         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Lock");
00076         pthread_mutex_lock(&queue_mutex);
00077         /*
00078         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Signal");
00079         pthread_cond_signal(&queue_cv); //try this
00080         pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00081         */
00082         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Cancel");
00083         //pthread_cancel(thread); //finish the bastard
00084         
00085         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Join");
00086         //pthread_join(thread, NULL); //this can block the killer!
00087         alive=false;
00088         
00089         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"UnLock");
00090         pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00091         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Done");
00092 }
00093 
00094 void Broadcaster::threadstart()
00095 {
00096         //printf("Broadcast thread\n");
00097         while (!finish)
00098         {
00099                 //pop the packet to send
00100                 //this must be done quickly
00101                 unsigned int uid;
00102                 int type;
00103                 unsigned int datalen;
00104                 if (finish)
00105                         pthread_exit(NULL);
00106                 //wait for an entry and lock the queue
00107                 pthread_mutex_lock(&queue_mutex);
00108                 while (queue_end==queue_start && !finish)
00109                         pthread_cond_wait(&queue_cv, &queue_mutex);
00110                 if (finish) 
00111                 {
00112                         pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00113                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Appropriate finish");
00114                         pthread_exit(NULL); //crash and burn
00115                 }
00116                 //pop stuff
00117                 uid=queue[queue_start].uid;
00118                 type=queue[queue_start].type;
00119                 datalen=queue[queue_start].datalen;
00120                 
00121                 memcpy(send_data, queue[queue_start].data, datalen);
00122                 queue_start++;
00123                 
00124                 if (queue_start==QUEUE_LENGTH)
00125                         queue_start-=QUEUE_LENGTH;
00126                 //unlock the queue
00127                 pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00128                 if (finish)
00129                         pthread_exit(NULL);
00130                 //Send message
00131                 if (Messaging::sendmessage(sock, type, uid, datalen, send_data))
00132                 {
00133                         sequencer->disconnect(id, "Broadcaster: Send error"); return;
00134                 }
00135         }
00136         pthread_exit(NULL);
00137 }
00138 
00139 //this is called all the way from the receiver threads, we should process this swiftly
00140 //and keep in mind that it is called crazily and concurently from lots of threads
00141 //we MUST copy the data too
00142 //also, this function can be called by threads owning clients_mutex !!!
00143 void Broadcaster::queueMessage(unsigned int uid, int type, char* data, unsigned int len)
00144 {
00145         //printf("Queue %i\n", type);
00146         //lock the queue
00147         pthread_mutex_lock(&queue_mutex);
00148         if (type!=MSG2_VEHICLE_DATA)
00149         {
00150                 //this is an out of band message
00151                 //queue at the start
00152                 //push the new message
00153                 queue_start--;
00154                 if (queue_start<0) queue_start+=QUEUE_LENGTH;
00155                 //the last message may disappear if the queue is full
00156                 //note that we always keep a free slot to distinguish a full queue from an empty one
00157                 if (queue_start==queue_end)
00158                 {
00159                         //pop the last message
00160                         queue_end--;
00161                         if (queue_end<0) queue_end+=QUEUE_LENGTH;
00162                 }
00163                 queue[queue_start].uid=uid;
00164                 queue[queue_start].type=type;
00165                 if (data) memcpy(queue[queue_start].data, data, len);
00166                 queue[queue_start].datalen=len;
00167         }
00168         else 
00169         {
00170                 //this is normal message
00171                 //queue at the end
00172                 int new_queue_end=queue_end+1;
00173                 if (new_queue_end==QUEUE_LENGTH) new_queue_end-=QUEUE_LENGTH;
00174                 if (new_queue_end!=queue_start)
00175                 {
00176                         queue[queue_end].uid=uid;
00177                         queue[queue_end].type=type;
00178                         if (data) memcpy(queue[queue_end].data, data, len);
00179                         queue[queue_end].datalen=len;
00180                         queue_end=new_queue_end;
00181                 } //else the queue is full, we drop the packet
00182         } 
00183         //signal the thread
00184         pthread_cond_signal(&queue_cv);
00185         //unlock the queue
00186         pthread_mutex_unlock(&queue_mutex);
00187 }
